Description: Sycomore fig wood canopic chest of Neby; painted sides bear Hieroglyphic text and representations of Neith, Selkis, Isis, Nephthys and Sons of Horus; plinth in form of sledge; contains four wooden canopic jars with lids in form of human heads.
Curator's comments: PM I Part 2: p.836 John Gadsby, My Wanderings: being Travels in the East in 1846-47, 1850-51, 1852-53 (London, c. 1871), I, 351, II, 414. Serpico and White in Davies, Colour and Painting, London 2001, p. 35, col. pl. 8 [3]. Taylor, Death and the Afterlife, 70
